title: heading role
description: A heading for a section of the page.

assertions.title: convey its role and name
assertions.rationale: The user needs to know that the element describes the following content and the name of the heading.
examples: When applied to a heading, the heading might be announced as something like "<name> heading level <level>"

assertions.title: convey its default level as 2 if aria-level is missing
assertions.rationale: The user needs to know the level of the heading if aria-level is missing.
examples: When applied to a heading, the heading might be announced as something like "<name> heading level <level>"

assertions.title: provide shortcuts to jump to headings
assertions.rationale: Headings provide an outline of the page and users need to be able to quickly navigate to different sections of the page.
